messages: 9fecb5f788ca4f471b210e9dca724d53 (02:00): MickMcMack: RCRuiz is making good progres on mental ray integration in blender
9fecb5f788ca4f471b210e9dca724d53 (02:00): just as he did for povray before
47e191364ea1c7af1561e21f1b3ae9f6 (02:02): as I told you guys , is dificil to kip up with the users that's way :(
47e191364ea1c7af1561e21f1b3ae9f6 (02:03): and mental is a little more complicated than pov
9fecb5f788ca4f471b210e9dca724d53 (02:13): I'm playing with the new modifier stack
9fecb5f788ca4f471b210e9dca724d53 (02:13): I just rigged a subsurfed cube :-p
28d5ade3858119655f5dda950d98b297 (02:16): does anyone here know what the code is for the music note character?
28d5ade3858119655f5dda950d98b297 (02:16): I don't know why you'd want to rig the subdivision results
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (02:17): Someone just walked by my desk and my text editor was scrolled over to the right by two characters...and it was in collapsed view.
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (02:17): The person goes "Why do you have a screenfull of ass?"
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (02:18): I had to show them it was a screenfull of classes, not asses.
9fecb5f788ca4f471b210e9dca724d53 (02:19): wavez: becouse you can get smoother blendig just by weight painting subsurf
62e8f44c528751bc52ab458d2b8886ee (02:20): ZanQdo, i would think it's very useful for hi-res models but totally useless for low-res game models
9fecb5f788ca4f471b210e9dca724d53 (02:21): motorsep-work: of course... low poly's dont need subdiv so thats pretty obvious
28d5ade3858119655f5dda950d98b297 (02:22): you will never get correctly bending joints for any type of realistic character with it
9fecb5f788ca4f471b210e9dca724d53 (02:28): if you want to give it a try
9fecb5f788ca4f471b210e9dca724d53 (02:28): I can't do tests with lattices becouse theres a bug :-(
28d5ade3858119655f5dda950d98b297 (02:28): ZanQdo, what I'll be excited about is using armatures on mirrored meshes
9fecb5f788ca4f471b210e9dca724d53 (02:29): he plan to add automatic vertexgroup generation
28d5ade3858119655f5dda950d98b297 (02:29): but I pretty sure the mirror modifier won't mirror the groups, not yet anyway
9fecb5f788ca4f471b210e9dca724d53 (02:29): if you have head.left for example
9fecb5f788ca4f471b210e9dca724d53 (02:29): mirror modifier will make head.right for you

28d5ade3858119655f5dda950d98b297 (02:36): ya, that's fantastic. I asked him about it a while back, because it's what I've wanted ever since the modifier stack was coded, and he told me what the difficulty of it was
9fecb5f788ca4f471b210e9dca724d53 (02:38): yeah, he said vertex groups are related to objects and not meshes or something like that
9fecb5f788ca4f471b210e9dca724d53 (02:38): anyway hes one smart coder, I'm sure he will find a way
8a754f7c9f6eaec9a34c89a556996c1d (02:57): does anyone know how to record what happens in blender realtime to IPO curves for animation?
87103c73f1d4ebce7a0d0f7cc72fd19d (03:15): how do I set a texture to show on each side of the cube? setting map input to Cube doesn't seem to do anything
87103c73f1d4ebce7a0d0f7cc72fd19d (03:16): it helps if you select the right texture first, apparently

13c252ae27b88f703dc1806b696bb3c4 (03:24): the normals determine which side of the face the texture is applied to.  I think there might be an option to make a poly 2-sided, but I've not had the need to do that before
